properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 10:00 P.M. EDT, scattered strong thunderstorms were located over portions of York and Durham regions. These thunderstorms are moving north at 40 km/h. Hazards: 70 to 80 km/h wind gusts and torrential rain. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include: Newmarket, Richmond Hill, Markham, Oshawa, Aurora, Uxbridge, Port Perry, Lindsay and Whitby. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-11T06:07:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T02:09:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2156703902.2020
Area: Uxbridge - Beaverton - Northern Durham Region, Newmarket - Georgina - Northern York Region, Pickering - Oshawa - Southern Durham Region, Vaughan - Richmond Hill - Markham, Fenelon Falls - Balsam Lake Park - Northern Kawartha Lakes, Lindsay - Southern Kawartha Lakes

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very warm weather is expected to continue. Time span: continuing until Saturday. Minimum temperature tonight: near 20 degrees Celsius. Maximum temperature Saturday: near 29 degrees Celsius. Locations: Upper Lake Melville. Remarks: Very warm temperatures will continue into Saturday as the warm air mass persists over the Upper Lake Melville area. Showers are expected to follow by Saturday evening, bringing somewhat cooler temperatures for the remainder of the weekend. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please call HealthLine 811 for advice on health risks, symptoms and precautions associated with heat. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-11T16:39:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T00:40:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3583364855.2020
Area: Upper Lake Melville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:42 PM EDT weather radar and lightning detector indicated isolated intense thunderstorms capable of producing heavy downpours with rainfall amounts of 30 to 40 mm per hours. These storms are moving northeast at 30 km/h. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The extreme heat wave will persist until tomorrow. A warm and humid air mass continues to affect Southern Quebec. The temperatures are not expected to fall below 20 degrees Celsius tonight. Temperatures will be cooler on Saturday, however the combined temperature and humidity values will still produce humidex values between 35 and 37. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-11T15:59:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T02:05:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0603576811.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:48 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 35 kilometres northwest of West Montreal River Provincial Park to 20 kilometres south of Matachewan to 12 kilometres east of Solace Provincial Park, moving north at 60 km/h. Locations impacted include: West Montreal River Provincial Park, Matachewan, Lady Evelyn-Smoothwater Provincial Park, Makobe-Grays River Provincial Park, Argyle Lake, Mistinikon Lake, Mistinikon Lake, Watabeag Lake, Slim Lake, Barris Lake, Kenaja Lake, Cariboo Lake, Makobe Lake, Alexander Lake, Alexander Lake and Elk Lake. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2020-07-11T04:39:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T01:49:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3669086953.2020
Area: Kirkland Lake - Englehart, Temiskaming Shores - Temagami

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An area of thunderstorms over the Niagara region is moving northward and is expected to move out over the western end of Lake Ontario by 10:30 P.M. EDT. These thunderstorms are capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots, as well as frequent lightning and reduced visibilities in heavy downpours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-11T05:18:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T02:20:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3147946319.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:17 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This cluster of severe thunderstorms is located from Malton to Caledon Village, moving north at 50 km/h. Hazards: 100 km/h wind gusts and nickel size hail. Source: Radar indicated. Wind damage has been reported with this thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include: Caledon, Forks of the Credit Provincial Park, Bolton, Schomberg, Nobleton, Caledon Village, Inglewood, Palgrave, Sandhill, Mayfield, Humber Grove, Wildfield, East Brampton, Linton and Kleinburg. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Hazard: Torrential rain producing local rainfall in excess of 50 milimetres per hour. Localized flash flooding is possible. Timing: Now continuing into the overnight. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:18 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, pea to dime size hail and heavy rain. This large cluster of thunderstorms is currently extending from near Listowel to Cambridge to near Guelph to the shores of Georgian Bay. The main threat with this cluster of thunderstorms continues to be heavy rain rates of 50 mm per hour or more. Locations impacted include: Waterloo, Kitchener, Guelph, Orangeville, Elmira, Arthur, Fergus, Grand Valley, Shelburne, Erin, Alma, Elora, Honeywood, Rockwood, Boyne Valley Provincial Park and Listowel. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:07 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing damaging wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located near Hamilton, moving north at 30 km/h. Hazard: 115 km/h wind gusts and nickel size hail. Source: Radar indicated. A wind gust of 116 km/h was reported in Burlington. Locations impacted include: Hamilton, Burlington, Waterdown, Bronte Creek Provincial Park, North Burlington, Burlington Skyway, Hamilton Beach, Appleby and Bronte. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-11T02:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-11T00:08:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1816274648.2020
Area: City of Hamilton, Burlington - Oakville
